verses.verse: Then I looked <S%H7200><s%> again <S%H7725><s%> at all <S%H3605><s%> the acts <S%H6217><s%> of oppression <S%H6217><s%> which <S%H834><s%> were being done <S%H6213><s%> under <S%H8478><s%> the sun. <S%H8121><s%> And behold <S%H2009><s%> [I saw] the tears <S%H1832><s%> of the oppressed <S%H6231><s%> and [that] they had <S%H369><s%> no <S%H369><s%> one <S%H369><s%> to comfort <S%H5162><s%> [them;] and on the side <S%H3027><s%> of their oppressors <S%H6231><s%> was power, <S%H3581><s%> but they had <S%H369><s%> no <S%H369><s%> one <S%H369><s%> to comfort <S%H5162><s%> [them.]

So I congratulated <S%H9576><s%> the dead <S%H4191><s%> who <S%H7945><s%> are already <S%H3528><s%> dead <S%H4191><s%> more <S%H4480><s%> than <S%H4480><s%> the living <S%H2416><s%> who <S%H834><s%> are still <S%H5728><s%> living. <S%H2416><s%>

But better <S%H2896><s%> [off] than <S%H4480><s%> both <S%H8147><s%> of them is the one who <S%H834><s%> has never <S%H3808><s%> existed, <S%H1961><s%> who <S%H834><s%> has never <S%H3808><s%> seen <S%H7200><s%> the evil <S%H7451><s%> activity <S%H4639><s%> that is done <S%H6213><s%> under <S%H8478><s%> the sun. <S%H8121><s%>

And I have seen <S%H7200><s%> that every <S%H3605><s%> labor <S%H5999><s%> and every <S%H3605><s%> skill <S%H3788><s%> which is done <S%H4639><s%> is [the result of] rivalry <S%H7068><s%> between a man <S%H376><s%> and his neighbor. <S%H7453><s%> This <S%H2088><s%> too <S%H1571><s%> is vanity <S%H1892><s%> and striving <S%H7469><s%> after wind. <S%H7307><s%>
The fool <S%H3684><s%> folds <S%H2263><s%> his hands <S%H3027><s%> and consumes <S%H398><s%> his own flesh. <S%H1320><s%>

One hand <S%H3709><s%> full <S%H4393><s%> of rest <S%H5183><s%> is better <S%H2896><s%> than <S%H4480><s%> two fists <S%H2651><s%> full <S%H4393><s%> of labor <S%H5999><s%> and striving <S%H7469><s%> after wind. <S%H7307><s%>
Then I looked <S%H7200><s%> again <S%H7725><s%> at vanity <S%H1892><s%> under <S%H8478><s%> the sun. <S%H8121><s%>

There <S%H3426><s%> was a certain <S%H259><s%> man <S%H259><s%> without <S%H369><s%> a dependent, <S%H8145><s%> having <S%H369><s%> neither <S%H1571><s%> <S%H369><s%> a son <S%H1121><s%> nor <S%H369><s%> a brother, <S%H251><s%> yet there <S%H369><s%> was no <S%H369><s%> end <S%H7093><s%> to all <S%H3605><s%> his labor. <S%H5999><s%> Indeed, <S%H1571><s%> his eyes <S%H5869><s%> were not satisfied <S%H7646><s%> with riches <S%H6239><s%> [and he never asked,] "And for whom <S%H4310><s%> am I laboring <S%H6001><s%> and depriving <S%H2637><s%> myself <S%H5315><s%> of pleasure <S%H9186><s%>?" This <S%H2088><s%> too <S%H1571><s%> is vanity <S%H1892><s%> and it is a grievous <S%H7451><s%> task. <S%H6045><s%>
Two <S%H8147><s%> are better <S%H2896><s%> than <S%H4480><s%> one <S%H259><s%> because <S%H834><s%> they have <S%H3426><s%> a good <S%H2896><s%> return <S%H7739><s%> for their labor. <S%H5999><s%>

For if <S%H518><s%> either of them falls, <S%H5307><s%> the one <S%H259><s%> will lift <S%H6965><s%> up his companion. <S%H2270><s%> But woe <S%H337><s%> to the one <S%H259><s%> who <S%H7945><s%> falls <S%H5307><s%> when there <S%H369><s%> is not another <S%H8145><s%> to lift <S%H6965><s%> him up.

Furthermore, <S%H1571><s%> if <S%H518><s%> two <S%H8147><s%> lie <S%H7901><s%> down <S%H7901><s%> together they keep <S%H2552><s%> warm, <S%H2552><s%> but how <S%H349><s%> can one <S%H259><s%> be warm <S%H2552><s%> [alone?]

And if <S%H518><s%> one <S%H259><s%> can overpower <S%H8630><s%> him who <S%H259><s%> is alone, two <S%H8147><s%> can resist <S%H5975><s%> <S%H5048><s%> him. A cord <S%H2339><s%> of three <S%H8027><s%> [strands] is not quickly <S%H4120><s%> torn <S%H5423><s%> apart. <S%H5423><s%>

A poor, <S%H4542><s%> yet wise <S%H2450><s%> lad <S%H3206><s%> is better <S%H2896><s%> than <S%H4480><s%> an old <S%H2205><s%> and foolish <S%H3684><s%> king <S%H4428><s%> who <S%H834><s%> no <S%H3808><s%> longer <S%H5750><s%> knows <S%H3045><s%> [how] to receive <S%H2094><s%> instruction. <S%H2094><s%>

For he has come <S%H3318><s%> out of prison <S%H1004><s%> <S%H631><s%> to become <S%H4427><s%> king, <S%H4427><s%> even <S%H1571><s%> though <S%H3588><s%> he was born <S%H3205><s%> poor <S%H7326><s%> in his kingdom. <S%H4438><s%>

I have seen <S%H7200><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> the living <S%H2416><s%> under <S%H8478><s%> the sun <S%H8121><s%> throng <S%H1980><s%> to the side <S%H5973><s%> of the second <S%H8145><s%> lad <S%H3206><s%> who <S%H834><s%> replaces <S%H5975><s%> <S%H8478><s%> him.

There <S%H369><s%> is no <S%H369><s%> end <S%H7093><s%> to all <S%H3605><s%> the people, <S%H5971><s%> to all <S%H3605><s%> who <S%H834><s%> were before <S%H6440><s%> them, and even <S%H1571><s%> the ones <S%H314><s%> who <S%H314><s%> will come <S%H314><s%> later <S%H314><s%> will not be happy <S%H8055><s%> with him, for this <S%H2088><s%> too <S%H1571><s%> is vanity <S%H1892><s%> and striving <S%H7475><s%> after wind. <S%H7307><s%>
